title: Ticket #4996: ClassAd function split() not documented
description:
The ClassAd builtin function split(), used for splitting a string, is not documented in section 4.1 of the manual. I believe its function signature is:

String list split(String s, [String tokens])

and it returns s split up by any of the characters in tokens (tokens is whitespace by default).
remarks:
2015-Apr-22 15:09:35 by tannenba:
Bump :)

2015-Apr-28 13:38:46 by tannenba:
Assigning this ticket to TJ so he can check that the documentation is correct, as TJ is the one who wrote the code, and also the one who failed to create a ticket for the code change, which is why it was probably never documented in the first place :P! See commit [31109].

2015-Apr-28 15:25:10 by johnkn:
DOC REVIEW: looks good.
